org.framed.orm.ui.action

Class RelationshipConstraintsAction

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.eclipse.core.commands.common.EventManager
      • org.eclipse.jface.action.AbstractAction
        • org.eclipse.jface.action.Action
          • org.eclipse.gef.ui.actions.WorkbenchPartAction
            • org.eclipse.gef.ui.actions.SelectionAction
              • org.framed.orm.ui.action.RelationshipConstraintsAction
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    org.eclipse.gef.Disposable, org.eclipse.gef.ui.actions.UpdateAction, org.eclipse.jface.action.IAction

    public class RelationshipConstraintsAction
extends org.eclipse.gef.ui.actions.SelectionAction
    This action is for adding/removing Relations from type total, cyclic, acyclic, reflexive and irreflexive to/from a Relation from type realtionship through a ConstraintsDialog.
    Author:
    Kay Bierzynski

    • Method Detail

      • setEditPart

        public void setEditPart(org.eclipse.gef.EditPart editPart)
        Set method for setting the editpart of the Relation from type relationship. This method is nessecary, because the run method of this action isn't only activated through the contextmenu. The run method is called as well when a Relations from type total, cyclic, acyclic, reflexive or irreflexive is selected and the user is clicking on the delete button (red X in the actionbar) and when called liked this no element is selected from which we can get the editpart.
        Parameters:
        editpart - EditPart

      • run

        public void run()
        In this method first the ConstraintsDialog is prepared and started. After the user has closed the ConstraintsDialog through the cancel button this method is finished as well. When the user has closed the ConstraintsDialog through the ok button the chosen Relations from type total, cyclic, acyclic, reflexive and irreflexive are added to the Relation from type relationship one after the another and all relationshipconstraints , which where not Chosen and belonged at the beginning to the relationship, are removed one after another from the relationship.
        Specified by:
        run in interface org.eclipse.jface.action.IAction
        Overrides:
        run in class org.eclipse.jface.action.Action

      • actionUndo

        public void actionUndo()
        Method for undoing the action. This method is called when the call of the run method through the CallRelationshipConstraintsActionCommand/delete button(red X in the actionbar) should be undone.

      • actionRedo

        public void actionRedo()
        Method for redoing the action. This method is called when the call of the run method through the CallRelationshipConstraintsActionCommand/delete button(red X in the actionbar) should be redone.
